title: What is Myki?
en: Myki is Victoria’s contactless smart card for trains, trams, and buses. Tap your card to pay for your journey. It’s accepted across most public transport in Melbourne and regional Victoria.

title: Where to Get a Myki Card
en: Buy a Myki card online, at station machines, PTV Hubs, or retailers like 7‑Eleven. Staff can help you with your purchase. Register your card online for balance protection.

title: How to Top Up Myki
en: Top up your Myki online, in the PTV app, at machines, or at retailers. Ask staff for help if needed. Always check your balance before travelling.

title: Touch On with Myki
en: Hold your Myki card to the reader until it beeps and shows green. Always touch on before boarding trains, trams, or buses. If you forget, you may be fined.

title: Touch Off with Myki
en: Touch off at the reader when you finish your trip on trains and buses. This ensures you pay the correct fare. On trams, touch off only outside the Free Tram Zone.

title: Tram Rules for Myki
en: On trams, you don’t need to touch off. Inside the Free Tram Zone, you don’t need to touch on. Outside the zone, always touch on before boarding.

title: Using Myki Gates
en: At train stations, use your Myki card at the gates to enter and exit. Hold your card to the reader until the gate opens. Ask staff for help if your card does not work.

title: Checking Myki Balance
en: Check your Myki balance on the reader or machine screen after you touch your card. Top up before travelling if your balance is low. You can also check your balance online or in the PTV app.

title: Printable Myki Guides
en: Official Myki guides are available as PDFs in many languages. They explain how to use Myki and travel on public transport. Download them from the official website for easy reference.
